p.em: "The House always wins. My hammer is just the receipt."

description.p: Paladins who swear the Oath of the Ledger are the cosmic debt collectors of the multiverse. They hunt oathbreakers, tax evaders of the soul, and those who try to cheat their destiny.

ul.li: Honor the Contract. A deal is a deal. No fine print can save you from the spirit of the agreement.
Collect What is Owed. Whether it is gold, blood, or a soul, you must ensure payment is made.
Zero Sum. For every stroke of luck, there is a cost. You are that cost.

sheet.description: You ensure all debts are paid, acting as an enforcer for cosmic balance.

description.p: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.
When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following two Channel Divinity options.

Asset Seizure. As an action, you present your holy symbol and demand payment from a creature within 30 feet that you can see. The creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, one object the creature is holding (such as a weapon or arcane focus) flies from its grasp and into your open hand (or lands at your feet if your hands are full). If the object is magical, the creature takes force damage equal to your paladin level.

Garnish Wages. As a reaction when a creature hits you with an attack, you can force them to pay the price. The attacker takes Force damage equal to the damage they just dealt to you. This damage ignores resistance.
As an action, force a creature within 30 ft to make a CHA save. On fail, you steal one held item. If it's magic, they take damage equal to your level.

sheet.description: Range 30ft. Target makes CHA Save. Fail: You take their weapon/item. If magic, deal {{level:paladin}} force damage.

description.p: As a reaction when hit, the attacker takes Force damage equal to the damage they dealt to you.

sheet.description: Trigger: You get hit. Effect: Attacker takes Force damage equal to the damage you took (Ignores Resistance).

description.p: Starting at 7th level, you emit an aura that taxes those who harm your allies. Whenever a hostile creature within 10 feet of you deals damage to you or a friendly creature, the attacker takes psychic damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1).
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

sheet.description: Hostiles within {{aura of interest:range}}ft take {{charisma:modifier}} Psychic damage when they deal damage to allies.

description.p: Starting at 15th level, you can advance credit to your allies at a steep cost to your enemies. When a creature you can see within 30 feet of you drops to 0 hit points, you can use your reaction to grant a friendly creature within 30 feet temporary hit points equal to half the damage that reduced the target to 0.

sheet.description: When a creature dies/drops to 0 within 30ft: Grant an ally 30ft away Temp HP equal to half the killing blow damage.

description.p: At 20th level, you can assume the form of the Ultimate Enforcer. Golden chains float around you, and your eyes burn like molten gold. As an action, you undergo a transformation that lasts for 1 minute:

ul.li: You gain a flying speed of 60 feet (hover).
You have truesight out to a range of 120 feet.

When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can force it to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failure, the creature is Banished (as per the spell) to a solitary confinement demiplane until the start of your next turn.

description.p: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: 1 Min. Fly 60ft, Truesight 120ft. Hit: CHA Save or Banished until start of next turn.

p.em: "I don't fight for glory. I fight because if I stop, the bill comes due."

description.p: The Oath of the Debtor is the path of those who have gambled their lives and lost, only to be given a second chance at a terrible interest rate.

ul.li: Buy Time. You are living on borrowed time. Make every second count.
Pass the Buck. If someone has to pay the price, ensure it isn't you.
Never Default. The consequences of breaking this contract are worse than death.

sheet.description: You fight with the desperation of one who owes a debt to the cosmos.

description.p: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.
When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following two Channel Divinity options.

Borrow Against the Future. As a bonus action, you immediately gain Temporary Hit Points equal to twice your Paladin level + your Charisma modifier. These temporary hit points last for 1 minute. When the effect ends (or if you lose all the temporary hit points), you take necrotic damage equal to the amount of temporary hit points you originally gained. This damage cannot be reduced in any way.

Transfer Liability. As a reaction when you take damage from a creature within 30 feet of you, you can force that creature to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes the damage instead of you. On a successful save, you both take half the damage.

element.name: Channel Divinity: Borrow Against the Future

description.p: Bonus Action. Gain Temp HP = (Level x 2) + CHA. Lasts 1 min. When ended/lost, take Necrotic damage equal to amount gained (cannot be reduced).

sheet.description: Gain {{debtor_borrow:hp}} Temp HP. When lost/expires, take {{debtor_borrow:hp}} Necrotic dmg (unavoidable).

description.p: Reaction when damaged by creature within 30 ft. Target makes CHA Save. Fail: They take full dmg. Success: Both take half.

sheet.description: When damaged by creature in 30ft: Target makes CHA Save. Fail: They take full damage. Success: You both take half.

description.p: Starting at 7th level, you project an aura of shared risk. The aura extends 10 feet from you in every direction.
Whenever you take damage, you can choose to deal necrotic damage equal to your Charisma modifier to a hostile creature within the aura.
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

sheet.description: When you take damage, deal {{charisma:modifier}} Necrotic damage to a hostile creature within {{aura of collateral:range}}ft.

description.p: Starting at 15th level, your desperation fuels your power. When you start your turn with less than half of your maximum hit points, you regain hit points equal to your Charisma modifier, and your melee weapon attacks deal an extra 1d8 necrotic damage until the end of the turn.

sheet.description: Start turn < 50% HP: Regen {{charisma:modifier}} HP and deal +1d8 Necrotic on melee attacks.

description.p: At 20th level, you can declare spiritual bankruptcy to reset the board. As an action, you become an Avatar of Ruin for 1 minute:

ul.li: You are immune to Necrotic and Poison damage.
If you would be reduced to 0 hit points, you instead drop to 1 hit point and can immediately teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space. You can use this effect once per round.
Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of you has disadvantage on all saving throws.

description.p: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: 1 Min. Immune Necrotic/Poison. If drop to 0HP -> 1HP + Teleport 30ft (1/Round). 30ft Aura: Disadvantage on all Saves.

p.em: "A deck of cards is 52 opportunities for a betrayal. I only need one."

description.p: You blend arcane infusion with sleight of hand, turning playing cards into deadly weapons.

p.em: "Pick a card. Any card. It'll be the last thing you see."

description.p: At 3rd level, you gain proficiency with playing cards. You treat playing cards as simple ranged weapons with the finesse and thrown properties (range 30/60). On a hit, they deal 1d6 slashing damage. These cards count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance.

sheet.description: Cards are 1d6 Finesse/Thrown weapons.

p.em: "Hearts for burning passion, Spades for the grave."

description.p: At 3rd level, your Sneak Attack is infused with the magic of the suits. When you deal Sneak Attack damage with a playing card, roll a d4 to determine a bonus effect:

ul.li: 1 (Hearts): Deal extra fire damage equal to your Dexterity modifier.
2 (Clubs): The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC = 8 + Prof + Cha) or be pushed 10 feet away.
3 (Diamonds): Deal extra force damage equal to your Dexterity modifier.
4 (Spades): The target cannot regain hit points until the start of your next turn.

sheet.description: Sneak Attack triggers Suit effect (Roll d4).

p.em: "You can't read a face that isn't there."

description.p: At 9th level, you become impossible to read. You are immune to magic that allows other creatures to read your thoughts, determine whether you are lying, or know your alignment. You can also perfectly palm Small or smaller objects, making them impossible to detect on your person without a physical search.

sheet.description: Immune to mind reading/truth detection. Perfect palming.

p.em: "I think it's time we switched seats."

description.p: At 13th level, you can manipulate positioning on the battlefield. As a bonus action, you can throw a card at a creature within 30 feet. The target must make a Charisma saving throw (DC = 8 + Prof + Cha).

ul.li: Failure: You and the target instantly swap places.
Success: You instantly teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the target.

description.p: You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once). You regain expended uses on a long rest.

sheet.description: Throw card (30 ft). Cha Save. Fail: Swap places. Success: Teleport next to them.

p.em: "Let's see how you handle a bad beat."

description.p: At 17th level, you can unleash your entire deck in a storm of blades. As an action, you spray cards in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + Prof + Dex).

ul.li: Failure: 8d6 slashing damage + 8d6 force damage.
Success: Half damage.

description.p: You can choose one creature who failed the save to apply your Sneak Attack damage to. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: 30 ft Cone. 8d6 Slash + 8d6 Force. Apply Sneak Attack to one.

p.em: "Certainty is a cage. Faith is the courage to roll the dice when you can't see the numbers."

description.p: Clerics of Chance believe that the only truth in the universe is the Golden Roll. They reject destiny and embrace the chaos of the moment.
You gain domain spells at the cleric levels listed in the Chance Domain Spells table.

p.em: "I like those odds."

description.p: At 1st level, you gain proficiency with gaming sets and the Deception skill. You learn the guidance cantrip if you don't already know it. When you cast guidance, the target rolls 2d4 and chooses the highest number to add to the check.

sheet.description: Guidance rolls 2d4 (take highest).

p.em: "Fortune favors the bold, and hits them twice."

description.p: Also at 1st level, whenever you roll a die for damage or healing for a spell of 1st level or higher, if you roll the maximum possible number on the die, you can roll that die again and add the new result to the total. This can happen multiple times if you continue to roll the maximum.

sheet.description: Damage/Healing dice explode on Max Roll.

p.em: "Let's try that again, shall we?"

description.p: At 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to alter a pivotal moment. As a reaction when a creature within 30 feet of you makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can force the creature to reroll the d20. You make this choice after seeing the roll but before the DM says whether the roll succeeds or fails.

sheet.description: Force a creature within 30 ft to reroll a d20.

p.em: "Heads I live, tails... well, let's hope for heads."

description.p: At 6th level, you can gamble with your own safety. When you take damage, you can use your reaction to roll a d6.

ul.li: 1-3: You take the damage as normal.
4-6: You take 0 damage and immediately teleport up to 10 feet to an unoccupied space.

description.p: You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once). You regain expended uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: When hit: Roll d6. 1-3 Normal dmg. 4-6 Zero dmg and teleport 10 ft.

description.p: Starting at 8th level, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

sheet.description: +{{wisdom:modifier}} dmg to Cleric Cantrips.

p.em: "The Golden Roll. It happens once in a lifetime."

description.p: At 17th level, you master the flow of chance.

ul.li: If you roll a 1 on a d20, it counts as a 20.
Your Cascading Fortune feature now triggers if you roll the highest two numbers on a damage or healing die (e.g., rolling a 5 or 6 on a d6).

sheet.description: Natural 1 counts as Natural 20. Exploding Dice trigger on Max or Max-1.

p.em: "The House does not gamble. The House invests. And you, my dear, are a very high-risk asset."

description.p: You have signed a contract of employment with the Proprietor. Your job is to enforce the House Rules, collect debts, and ensure that the odds always favor your patron.
The Proprietor lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. Most involve control, surveillance, or enforcement of terms.

p.em: "The odds are never in your favor."

description.p: Starting at 1st level, you learn to manipulate probability in your favor. When a creature within 60 feet of you makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw with advantage, you can use your reaction to cancel the advantage. If you do so, you gain a House Chip (a d6). Within the next minute, you can roll this chip and add the number rolled to one attack roll, ability check, or saving throw you make.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: When a creature within 60 ft rolls with Advantage, you can cancel it. If you do, you gain a House Chip (d6) to add to your own roll within 1 minute.

p.em: "My best employees get... special protections."

description.p: At 6th level, your patron ensures their assets are protected. When you are hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to swap places with a willing creature within 30 feet of you. If you have cast hex on a creature within 30 feet, you can swap places with them (unwillingly) instead. The creature you swapped with takes the hit.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: Swap places with willing or Hexed creature within 30 ft to make them take the hit.

p.em: "I see everything. Even the cards you haven't drawn yet."

description.p: At 10th level, your senses are heightened to detect cheats and frauds. You are immune to being charmed. You gain proficiency in the Insight skill. If you are already proficient, you gain expertise. Additionally, you gain truesight out to a range of 15 feet.

sheet.description: Immune to Charmed. Truesight 15 ft.

p.em: "Your debt is due. Immediately."

description.p: At 14th level, you can call in a debt with lethal force. As an action, you touch a creature. The target must make a Charisma saving throw against your warlock spell save DC. On a failed save, the target takes 10d10 force damage. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage.
If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, you rip a fragment of their soul free, manifesting as a Soul Coin. You can consume this coin as a bonus action to regain one warlock spell slot.

sheet.description: Touch attack. Cha Save. Fail: 10d10 Force. If 0 HP, gain Soul Coin.

p.em: "Did you really think you could beat the Dealer?"

description.p: At 20th level, you can channel the ultimate authority of the Proprietor. As an action, you can transform for 1 minute. While transformed:

ul.li: You are immune to critical hits.
When a creature you can see makes a d20 roll, you can use your reaction to treat the roll as a 10. You can do this a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier.
You can cast counterspell or dispel magic at 5th level without expending a spell slot.

description.p: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: 1 Minute transformation. Immune to Crits. Reaction to force a roll of 10. Free Counterspell/Dispel Magic.
